artifacts.summary: Detailed analysis of Option A (constructive Lindenbaum) for F/P witness obligations, finding it infeasible as described but identifying a viable sub-chain approach (Option A')

partial_progress.details: Comprehensive 838-line research report analyzing Option A in depth. G-derivability independence metatheorem does NOT hold (counterexample via temp_a axiom). Joint witness consistency does NOT hold (counterexample: F(p) and F(neg p) coexist). Identified viable sub-chain approach (omega^2 construction) that processes F-witnesses one-at-a-time within each time point. Two remaining sorries (forward_F, backward_P) require augmented seed construction.
key_findings: G-derivability independence fails due to temp_a axiom (phi -> G(P(phi)))
Joint consistency of all F-witnesses fails (F(p) and F(neg p) can coexist)
Cross-sign sorries (1-2) are ALREADY RESOLVED in current code - only 2 sorries remain
Single witness per step insufficient without F-formula persistence guarantee
Sub-chain approach (omega^2 construction) is mathematically correct but complex (30-40h)
temporal_witness_seed_consistent is the key consistency lemma - proven and available
Placing psi in seed prevents G(neg psi) via T-axiom contradiction
